author: Dalit Halevi
title: PA criticizes Smotrich and Ben Gvir
text:
The Palestinian Authorityâ€™s (PA) foreign affairs bureau on Thursday denounced the response of Ministers Bezalel Smotrich and Itamar Ben Gvir to 


the order


 signed by US President Joe Biden imposing sanctions on four Israelis who, he claimed, were involved in attacks on Palestinian Arabs in Judea and Samaria.



Smotrich said in response, "The â€˜violence campaignâ€™ is an antisemitic lie spread by Israel's enemies, aimed at discrediting and harming the Jewish residents of Judea and Samaria, thereby disputing the existence of the entire State of Israel. This is an anti-moral BDS campaign that turns the victim into the aggressor and permits Jewish blood. It's a shame that the Biden administration is cooperating with this at a time when Jews are paying a heavy price in blood and losing the best of their sons in the war in Gaza.â€



Ben Gvir said, "The time has come for America to rethink its policy in Judea and Samaria. President Biden is mistaken when it comes to the heroic citizens of Israel and residents of Judea and Samaria. The ones who are attacked, the ones who are pelted with stones in attempts to harm and murder them, are the heroic residents of Judea and Samaria."



The PAâ€™s foreign affairs bureau welcomed the "progressive American decision that is in line with the interest of peace in the region" and called the words of Smotrich and Ben Gvir "a clear racist colonialist approach and a blatant provocation towards international peace and a deliberate destruction of the opportunity to implement the principle of the two-state solution."




Related articles:



Israel's plan for a military government in Gaza
 


PA cabinet leader urges sanctions against Israel
 


Palestinian Authority to accept funds from Israel
 


Cabinet approves sending PA funds to Norway
 





The bureau also claimed that "factors in Israel tend to accuse those who oppose racism, violation of international law and committing crimes of antisemitism."



"The statements of Smotrich and Ben Gvir reflect an official acknowledgment of the support, arming, encouragement and protection of the terrorist settler elements who carry out the attacks and crimes against the Palestinian residents without any reason," the statement said.

author: Zero Hora
title: Inmet alerta para risco de tempestade em Ã¡reas da Fronteira Oeste e MissÃµes a partir da madrugada desta sexta-feira
text:
A partir da meia-noite desta sexta-feira (13) entra em vigor um alerta amarelo emitido pelo Instituto Nacional de Meteorologia (Inmet) que indica "perigo potencial" de tempestade em uma faixa restrita da fronteira do Rio Grande do Sul com a Argentina. VÃ¡lido atÃ© o meio-dia, o comunicado abrange Ã¡reas da regiÃ£o das MissÃµes, Norte, Nordeste e Fronteira Oeste.
Nestas regiÃµes hÃ¡ possibilidade de queda de granizo e rajadas de vento entre 40 km/h e 60 km/h. O volume de chuva pode variar de 20 a 30 milÃ­metros (mm) por hora ou atÃ© 50mm nas 12 horas de validade do comunicado.
MunicÃ­pios como Alegrete, Uruguaiana, SÃ£o Borja, Santo Ã‚ngelo e Frederico Westphalen estÃ£o contemplados no alerta. O risco de cortes de energia elÃ©trica e alagamentos nestas regiÃµes Ã© considerado baixo pelo Inmet.
O comunicado tambÃ©m abrange toda a faixa oeste dos Estados de Santa Catarina e ParanÃ¡.
Cuidados
Durante a tempestade Ã© recomendado evitar abrigo sob Ã¡rvores, pois hÃ¡ "leve risco de queda de galhos e descargas elÃ©tricas". Em caso de raios, a orientaÃ§Ã£o Ã© nÃ£o utilizar aparelhos eletrÃ´nicos, como celulares, ligados Ã  tomada.
Em situaÃ§Ãµes de risco busque ajuda junto Ã  Defesa Civil (199) ou Corpo de Bombeiros (193).

author: About the Author
title: WHO Paper Raises Concerns about Multimodal Gen AI Models -- Campus Technology
text: Advanced Search Generative AI Unless developers and governments adjust their practices around generative AI, large multimodal models may be adopted faster than they can be made safe for use, warns a new paper by the World Health Organization (WHO). The publication, "Ethics and governance of artificial intelligence for health: Guidance on large multi-modal models," offers updated guidance for the ethical use of AI to account for large multimodal models. While the paper is aimed at operators and regulators in healthcare, its findings apply to any industry affected by the increasingly widespread use of generative AI technologies. Large multimodal models, or LMMs, refer to generative AI models that are able to ingest and generate information in multiple formats, including text, images, video, and audio. LMMs can also generate outputs that are in a different format than what they were fed. This versatility makes them useful for a wider range of tasks than so-called "unimodal" AI models. They are also better able to contextualize data that they are fed, and in turn generate outputs that are more nuanced. As such, the WHO notes, LMMs "have been adopted faster than any consumer application in history." However, the agency warns that LMMs are a whole new can of worms than other AI models that consumers may be more familiar with. The way that "LMMs are accessed and used is new" compared to other types of AI, according to the paper, "with both novel benefits and risks that societies, health systems and end-users may not yet be prepared to address fully." The risks of widespread LMM use noted in the paper include: Existing guidelines around the use of AI need to be updated to consider the risks presented by LMMs, says the WHO. "Regulations and laws written to govern the use of AI may not be fit to address either the challenges or opportunities associated with LMMs." Overall, however, the WHO says the original six ethical AI principles it laid out in 2021 still apply to LMMs. Those are: Protect autonomy; promote human well-being, human safety, and the public interest; ensure transparency, "explainability," and intelligibility; foster responsibility and accountability; ensure inclusiveness and equity; and promote AI that is responsive and sustainable. "[T]he underlying ethical challenges identified in the guidance and the core ethical principles and recommendations ... remain relevant both for assessing and for effectively and safely using LMMs," the agency said, "even as additional gaps in governance and challenges have and will continue to arise with respect to this new technology." The full paper is available for download on the WHO site. About the Author Gladys Rama (@GladysRama3) is the editorial director of Converge360. View More Webcasts View More Whitepapers

author: @infoitinterno
title: Sciopero-flop, adesioni basse da scuola, poste e trasporti
text:
Sciopero-flop, adesioni basse da scuola, poste e trasporti
Articolo Precedente
Articolo Successivo
Il recente sciopero generale indetto da Cgil, Uil e sindacati di base, che ha coinvolto vari settori pubblici e privati, ha registrato adesioni piuttosto basse, nonostante le dichiarazioni trionfalistiche di Maurizio Landini dal palco di Bologna. Secondo i dati preliminari comunicati dal Ministero dell'Istruzione e del Merito, l'adesione nel comparto scolastico si Ã¨ attestata al 5,65%, con il 57% delle scuole che hanno fornito i dati. Tra i dirigenti scolastici, la partecipazione Ã¨ stata del 1,5%, mentre i docenti hanno aderito con una percentuale del 5,54%.
In una nota, i sindacati hanno esultato, affermando che mezzo milione di persone hanno partecipato alle manifestazioni nelle quarantatrÃ© piazze italiane. Tuttavia, l'analisi dei numeri mostra una realtÃ  diversa, con punte di adesione che non hanno superato il 6% nel settore scolastico. Anche i Cobas e i ricercatori universitari sono scesi in piazza, come riportato da Antenna Tre, con interviste a rappresentanti del Coordinamento CORDA e ADL Cobas.
Il Ministro Valditara si Ã¨ detto soddisfatto dei risultati, sottolineando che lo sciopero non ha avuto un impatto significativo sul funzionamento delle scuole. Nonostante le manifestazioni abbiano toccato punte del 70% di adesioni in diversi comparti sul territorio, con episodi di guerriglia urbana a Torino, dove sono state bruciate immagini di esponenti politici della maggioranza di Governo, il settore scolastico ha mostrato una partecipazione limitata.
Lo sciopero generale del 29 novembre ha visto una partecipazione contenuta nel comparto educativo, con adesioni che non hanno superato il 6%, e una risposta piÃ¹ significativa in altri settori, ma con episodi di violenza che hanno caratterizzato alcune manifestazioni.

author: @zazoomblog
title: Caldo record | quali sono gli effetti delle temperature estreme e quando finirÃ  a luglio
text:
Caldo record | quali sono gli effetti delle temperature estreme e quando finirÃ  a luglio
LÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ondata di caldo record sta segnando lÃ¢â‚¬â„¢estate italiana, portando con sÃƒÂ© conseguenze drammatiche e preoccupanti. Due turisti e un camionista hanno perso la vita a causa delle temperature estreme, che in alcune zone superano i 40Ã‚Â°C. Ma quando finirÃƒ questa ondata di calore? E quali sono gli effetti a lungo termine su salute e ambiente? Scopriamolo insieme, perchÃƒÂ© il caldo insostenibile ci ricorda che lÃ¢â‚¬â„¢estate 2023 sta scrivendo pagine senza precedenti.
Due turisti sono morti per malori in spiaggia in Sardegna, a Budoni e a San Teodoro dove le temperature hanno superato i 40 gradi. Avevano 75 e 57 anni. Anche un camionista ÃƒÂ¨ stato trovato morto allÃ¢â‚¬â„¢alba nel suo tir sulla A4 tra Sirmione e Peschiera del Garda in provincia di Brescia. VenerdÃƒÂ¬ 5 luglio ci sarÃƒ il bollino rosso in 20 cittÃƒ . E il governo vara un protocollo per il lavoro, mentre nasce un caso sugli incentivi ai raider che circolano anche con il sole rovente. Il Piemonte allarga anche a loro lÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ordinanza che vieta il lavoro nelle ore a rischio. Intanto arrivano le tempeste: allerta per i temporali in Lombardia e Toscana.
[ðŸ”— Leggi su Open.online]
In questa notizia si parla di: sono - temperature - caldo - record
I giocatori di Wiegman, sicuri dellÃ¢â‚¬â„¢Inghilterra sono ben preparati per le temperature svizzere gonfie - Cari appassionati di calcio, mentre le Leonesse iniziano con grinta la difesa del titolo europeo, Sarina Wiegman rassicura: i suoi giocatori sono pronti ad affrontare le temperature elevate in Svizzera.
Ecco siamo tra il 38Ã‚Âº ed il 42Ã‚Âº paralleloÃ¢â‚¬Â¦. ? CALDO RECORD TRA IL 38Ã‚Âº E IL 42Ã‚Âº PARALLELO ? Ci troviamo in una fascia geografica dove il caldo avanza in maniera impressionante, e mai come in questi giorni si sono toccate temperature cosÃƒÂ¬ alte in molt[Vai su Facebook]
Caldo record, Europa soffoca e le temperature non danno tregua[Vai su X]
Caldo record in Italia, le ultime notizie in diretta | Oggi temperature fino a 40 gradi. Bambina di 10 anni muore a Versailles: Ã‚Â«Un colpo di caloreÃ‚Â». Malore in spiaggia: due morti in Sardegna; Caldo record in Europa, davvero in Spagna si sono raggiunti 54 Ã‚Â°C? Non proprio, capiamo come leggere la mappa ESA; Caldo record: quali sono gli effetti delle temperature estreme e quando finirÃƒ a luglio.
Caldo record, in Spagna la temperatura del suolo arriva a 54 gradi, in Italia si sfiorano i 50 a Foggia. Le immagini del satellite - Fa caldo come non mai in Europa, e questa volta a misurarlo non sono solo termometri o stazioni meteorologiche, ma anche i satelliti. Si legge su msn.com

author: TNN
title: Rhino Calf: Rhino calf rescued in Kaziranga National Park | Guwahati News - Times of India
text: Guwahati: A two-year-old female rhino calf which was separated from its mother was rescued from the floodwaters inside the Kaziranga National Parkâ€™s Kohora range on Wednesday evening.According to teams of the Assam forest line and mobile veterinary service from the Centre for Wildlife Rehabilitation and Conservation (CWRC), managed by the Assam forest department and the Wildlife Trust of India, the calf was found struggling to stay afloat inside the park.After its rescue, the calf was transported to the CWRC and is currently being monitored 24X7 by a team of veterinarians and animal keepers, officials added.We also published the following articles recentlySeparated from mother, 2-year-old rhino calf rescued from flood in Assam's Kaziranga national parkLearn about the successful rescue of a 2-year-old female rhino calf from floodwaters in Kaziranga National Park. The calf, separated from its mother, is now receiving round-the-clock care at the Centre for Wildlife Rehabilitation and Conservation. Follow the journey of this calf as it prepares to return to the wild.111494892Assam floods: 17 wild animals drown, 72 rescued in Kaziranga National ParkLearn about the recent flooding in Kaziranga National Park where 17 wild animals tragically drowned. Forest authorities rescued 72 animals, with 32 under treatment. The flood situation remains severe in Kaziranga, affecting 173 forest camps. Assam is also grappling with flooding, impacting over 16.25 lakh people in 29 districts.111477144Four animals dead in flooded Kaziranga National Park, 24 rescuedLearn about the recent flooding in Kaziranga National Park where four hog deer drowned and 24 animals were rescued. Find out how the flood waters are impacting the park's ecosystem and why experts believe floods are essential for its preservation.111433788

author: Bharat Khanna
title: Power Demand: Rain brings down power demand in Punjab | Chandigarh News - Times of India
text: Patiala: Power demand in Punjab declined by around 3,000 MW on Thursday due to rainfall in some parts of the state. The demand ranged between 11,400 to 13,400 MW throughout the day. This is in contrast to the maximum power demand of 15,441 MW on Wednesday and 15,658 MW on Tuesday, which was higher than the corresponding period last year when it was 14,770 MW.The month of July witnessed 25% more power consumption compared to last year and on July 17 and 20, the power demand reached 16,023 MW and 16,037 MW respectively. Meanwhile, two thermal power units in Punjab have been facing shutdown, including one unit at GATP Goindwal Sahib allegedly due to technical issues on Thursday. Boiler leakage shut down one unit at the govt-run power plant in Ropar on July 30. One unit of Punjab's independent power producer (IPP) in Mansa tripped for a few hours on Thursday but revived later. We also published the following articles recentlyAir India and Honeywell sign agreement for auxiliary power unit aftermarket supportAir India, owned by the Tata group, signed a long-term agreement with Honeywell for Auxiliary Power Unit (APU) aftermarket support. This accord aims to ensure high aircraft dispatch reliability and fleet availability while reducing maintenance costs. The agreement covers over 300 aircraft, including Air India's new B737-8 fleet and legacy A320 and B777 models.112128649200 mini steel plants in Chhattisgarh to shut down over power tariff hikeAround 200 mini steel plants in Chhattisgarh announced a shutdown from Monday evening in protest of a recent electricity tariff hike. This strike is expected to affect 250,000 to 300,000 workers. The association of these plants seeks favorable government action to resume operations, emphasizing the economic impact and the difficulty of reviving closed industries.112115757CSPDCL defends power tariff hike as mini steel plants shut down in protestAfter 200 steel plants ceased operations due to increased power tariffs, the Chhattisgarh State Power Distribution Company Ltd (CSPDCL) noted that high-tension steel industries receive a Rs 713 crore annual electricity subsidy. Despite reduced discounts, these industries still enjoy lower rates compared to other states. The tariff increase for 2024-25 results in energy charges rising to Rs 6.35 per unit.112143336
